text: This is an example of a busy wait.
This program will get stuck in this loop, eternally checking to see if any button b in self.buttons has been clicked.
At this point, it will break from the busy wait to return b's label.
So, in essence, it's not testing for anything.
It's just waiting until a condition is met.
That being said, the busy wait is considered an anti-pattern.

If you have control over this codebase (and this is more than just a trivial toy application), consider looking into whether this condition can be checked as part of a larger application main loop, or if the object provides a way that that event can be waited on (say, with a callback, or in a separate thread).
